intro: Dichapetalum mombuttense, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. It is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has traditional uses in some African cultures, including as a source of latex and for medicinal purposes.
